We arrived as walk ins to find the restaurant empty but fully booked so we made contact via WhatsApp to come the following day.  The response was quick and helpful.  They were able to fit us in but unfortunately we only had an hour to eat. 

As English speaking guests, we felt we were not the typical customers for this restaurant.  There were no English menus but the waitress asked the chef who spoke good English to help us.  He was a top bloke and made excellent recommendations. 

The place is clean. Mainly contemporary decoration but quirky with a very old and traditional table in the centre surrounded by modern tables and furniture. 

The food was excellent. We really enjoyed it - the best pizza we had in Ancona.  

We would have liked to try some of the craft beers they sell and we could have ordered well enough with our poor Italian language skills but didn’t want the fuss of the chef being fetched every time so we ate and left. 

Really recommend the food here.
